intro: Stellaria winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's starwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like the carnation and sweet William. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or pink flowers and delicate, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Stellaria winkleri is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
